text: hi everyone today I'm making a
traditional Vietnamese cookie called
Manta hell it literally means PCEs
cookie is a childhood snack for many
Vietnamese the little curvy cookies are
quite crunchy and it looks quite like a
pig's ear maybe that's why they call it
this year cookie like give it a try
recipes the ingredients you're going to
need hundred 70 gram of all-purpose
flour 3 tbsp sugar 1 egg yolk lightly
beaten with a folk 20 gram of butter
melted 50 ml coconut milk or you can
also use normal fresh milk for us
measurements please check the infobox
below
frost they combine the sugar with the
coconut milk and a pinch of salt stir to
dissolve you can heat it up for about 30
seconds in the microwave so it's this
are faster then add the beaten egg yolk
and the melted butter and also a
teaspoon of lime juice
divide the UH purpose flour into two
bowls one small bowls with 70 gram and
the other with hundred gram mix the
smaller portion with half a teaspoon of
cacao powder then Pau about 2/5 of the
egg mixture into the small bowl and stir
well so the flour can absorb the liquid
then you can eat with your hands until
it come together to form a dough the
cacao powder will make your dough have a
nice chocolate color then put the rest
of the egg mixture into the other bowl
and also need until its form into a
yellow piece of dough you will have a
nice soft and smooth piece of dough
now roll the yellow piece of dough into
the thickness of a half a centimeter
then do the same with the brown piece of
dough making sure the two sheets are
quite the same size brush some water on
the yellow piece of dough and lift up
the brown piece and place on top the
water will have the two sheet to stick
together better then roll up very
tightly into a lot wrap it up in a piece
of plastic wrap and put into the fridge
for about two hours so the dough can
firms up and is easier to slice after
two hours take it out and use a very
sharp knife to slide into really thin
slices Wow look at that
so beautiful words
hit about 1 inch of vegetable in a pan
until you see bubbles appear rather
chopstick like this turn the heat to
very low gently drop in the dough slices
and fry for just about 10 seconds for
sight when it's lightly covered
you can already flip it over and fry the
other types for just a few more seconds
the yellow parts should still stay pale
yellow and should not turn golden brown
if you would like sprinkle some sesame
seeds on each slice and roll it flat so
the system a can stick into this life
while so cute they look just like tiny
little pictures traditional bantha hell
are made with the fry method like this
but if you prefer the healthier version
you can also bake it in the oven at
hundred eighty degrees Celsius for about
10 minutes they will still be crunchy
but they won't curl flight the pig's ear
take them out and place on paper towel
to drain off the excess oil Wow look at
that so tempting just let them cool down
completely and put into a container or a
securely closed ziplock bag and you can
keep them for several weeks so what are
you waiting for
you can totally give this recipe a try
for your Christmas or New Year
preparation I hope you like them and
please subscribe to my channel for more
delicious Vietnamese food check out my
playlist for more cooking ideas thank
you for watching bye bye
